paragraphs.content: Chapter 43
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 43

paragraphs.content: But now thus saith the LORD that created thee, O Jacob, and he that formed thee, O Israel, Fear not: for I have redeemed thee, I have called thee by thy name; thou art mine.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But now thus saith the Lord that created thee, O Jacob, and he that formed thee, O Israel, Fear not: for I have redeemed thee, I have called thee by thy name; thou art mine.

paragraphs.content: When thou passest through the waters, I will be with thee; and through the rivers, they shall not overflow thee: when thou walkest through the fire, thou shalt not be burned; neither shall the flame kindle upon thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When thou passest through the waters, I will be with thee; and through the rivers, they shall not overflow thee: when thou walkest through the fire, thou shalt not be burned; neither shall the flame kindle upon thee.

paragraphs.content: For I am the LORD thy God, the Holy One of Israel, thy Saviour: I gave Egypt for thy ransom, Ethiopia and Seba for thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For I am the Lord thy God, the Holy One of Israel, thy Saviour: I gave Egypt for thy ransom, Ethiopia and Seba for thee.

paragraphs.content: Since thou wast precious in my sight, thou hast been honourable, and I have loved thee: therefore will I give men for thee, and people for thy life.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Since thou wast precious in my sight, thou hast been honourable, and I have loved thee: therefore will I give men for thee, and people for thy life.

paragraphs.content: Fear not: for I am with thee: I will bring thy seed from the east, and gather thee from the west;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Fear not: for I am with thee: I will bring thy seed from the east, and gather thee from the west;

paragraphs.content: I will say to the north, Give up; and to the south, Keep not back: bring my sons from far, and my daughters from the ends of the earth;
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will say to the north, Give up; and to the south, Keep not back: bring my sons from far, and my daughters from the ends of the earth;

paragraphs.content: Even every one that is called by my name: for I have created him for my glory, I have formed him; yea, I have made him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Even every one that is called by my name: for I have created him for my glory, I have formed him; yea, I have made him.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Bring forth the blind people that have eyes, and the deaf that have ears.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Bring forth the blind people that have eyes, and the deaf that have ears.

paragraphs.content: Let all the nations be gathered together, and let the people be assembled: who among them can declare this, and shew us former things? let them bring forth their witnesses, that they may be justified: or let them hear, and say, It is truth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let all the nations be gathered together, and let the people be assembled: who among them can declare this, and shew us former things? let them bring forth their witnesses, that they may be justified: or let them hear, and say, It is truth.

paragraphs.content: Ye are my witnesses, saith the LORD, and my servant whom I have chosen: that ye may know and believe me, and understand that I am he: before me there was no God formed, neither shall there be after me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Ye are my witnesses, saith the Lord, and my servant whom I have chosen: that ye may know and believe me, and understand that I am he: before me there was no God formed, neither shall there be after me.

paragraphs.content: I, even I, am the LORD; and beside me there is no saviour.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I, even I, am the Lord; and beside me there is no saviour.

paragraphs.content: I have declared, and have saved, and I have shewed, when there was no strange god among you: therefore ye are my witnesses, saith the LORD, that I am God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I have declared, and have saved, and I have shewed, when there was no strange god among you: therefore ye are my witnesses, saith the Lord, that I am God.

paragraphs.content: Yea, before the day was I am he; and there is none that can deliver out of my hand: I will work, and who shall let it?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yea, before the day was I am he; and there is none that can deliver out of my hand: I will work, and who shall let it?

paragraphs.content: ¶ Thus saith the LORD, your redeemer, the Holy One of Israel; For your sake I have sent to Babylon, and have brought down all their nobles, and the Chaldeans, whose cry is in the ships.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Thus saith the Lord, your redeemer, the Holy One of Israel; For your sake I have sent to Babylon, and have brought down all their nobles, and the Chaldeans, whose cry is in the ships.

paragraphs.content: I am the LORD, your Holy One, the creator of Israel, your King.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I am the Lord, your Holy One, the creator of Israel, your King.

paragraphs.content: Thus saith the LORD, which maketh a way in the sea, and a path in the mighty waters;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thus saith the Lord, which maketh a way in the sea, and a path in the mighty waters;

paragraphs.content: Which bringeth forth the chariot and horse, the army and the power; they shall lie down together, they shall not rise: they are extinct, they are quenched as tow.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Which bringeth forth the chariot and horse, the army and the power; they shall lie down together, they shall not rise: they are extinct, they are quenched as tow.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Remember ye not the former things, neither consider the things of old.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Remember ye not the former things, neither consider the things of old.

paragraphs.content: Behold, I will do a new thing; now it shall spring forth; shall ye not know it? I will even make a way in the wilderness, and rivers in the desert.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, I will do a new thing; now it shall spring forth; shall ye not know it? I will even make a way in the wilderness, and rivers in the desert.

paragraphs.content: The beast of the field shall honour me, the dragons and the owls: because I give waters in the wilderness, and rivers in the desert, to give drink to my people, my chosen.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The beast of the field shall honour me, the dragons and the owls: because I give waters in the wilderness, and rivers in the desert, to give drink to my people, my chosen.

paragraphs.content: This people have I formed for myself; they shall shew forth my praise.
paragraphs.contentHtml: This people have I formed for myself; they shall shew forth my praise.

paragraphs.content: ¶ But thou hast not called upon me, O Jacob; but thou hast been weary of me, O Israel.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ But thou hast not called upon me, O Jacob; but thou hast been weary of me, O Israel.

paragraphs.content: Thou hast not brought me the small cattle of thy burnt offerings; neither hast thou honoured me with thy sacrifices. I have not caused thee to serve with an offering, nor wearied thee with incense.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast not brought me the small cattle of thy burnt offerings; neither hast thou honoured me with thy sacrifices. I have not caused thee to serve with an offering, nor wearied thee with incense.

paragraphs.content: Thou hast bought me no sweet cane with money, neither hast thou filled me with the fat of thy sacrifices: but thou hast made me to serve with thy sins, thou hast wearied me with thine iniquities.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast bought me no sweet cane with money, neither hast thou filled me with the fat of thy sacrifices: but thou hast made me to serve with thy sins, thou hast wearied me with thine iniquities.

paragraphs.content: I, even I, am he that blotteth out thy transgressions for mine own sake, and will not remember thy sins.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I, even I, am he that blotteth out thy transgressions for mine own sake, and will not remember thy sins.

paragraphs.content: Put me in remembrance: let us plead together: declare thou, that thou mayest be justified.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Put me in remembrance: let us plead together: declare thou, that thou mayest be justified.

paragraphs.content: Thy first father hath sinned, and thy teachers have transgressed against me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thy first father hath sinned, and thy teachers have transgressed against me.

paragraphs.content: Therefore I have profaned the princes of the sanctuary, and have given Jacob to the curse, and Israel to reproaches.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore I have profaned the princes of the sanctuary, and have given Jacob to the curse, and Israel to reproaches.
